elements.title: Onekaka Power Station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the rebuilt Onekaka Power Station is controlled remotely using text messages via the cellular phone network?

elements.title: R. Champakalakshmi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Indian historian R. Champakalakshmi was a script consultant for Bharat Ek Khoj, a television series based on Jawaharlal Nehru's The Discovery of India?

elements.title: 20 consecutive winning seasons (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tom Landry led the Dallas Cowboys of the National Football League to a record 20 consecutive winning seasons?

elements.title: Jack Biddle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jack Biddle was the first and only person to be elected to the Alabama Legislature as a Democratic, Republican, and independent representative?

elements.title: Slavic Legion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that only 130 personnel joined the United States Army's Slavic Legion?

elements.title: 1973 Nobel Peace Prize (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1973 Nobel Peace Prize is the only Nobel Peace Prize ever to have been declined?

elements.title: 1993 Pacific hurricane season generated more than double (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1993 Pacific hurricane season generated more than double the average number of major hurricanes, which have sustained winds of at least 111 mph (179 km/h)?

elements.title: Tim Burke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that sports journalist Tim Burke specialized in capturing "offbeat" moments through GIFs?
